summary: 4/5 issues from Round 1 resolved (1 fixed, 2 removed, 1 documented), 1 accepted as architectural. No new issues found.

round1_verification.notes: Two sessions remain: _get_aiohttp_session() for search/fetch and fetch_contact_org_ids_batch() with its own session. Accepted as architectural - these are separate operations (conversation search vs contact lookup) and session sharing would require significant refactoring with unclear benefits.
_get_aiohttp_session() now includes sock_read=self.timeout[1] at line 251, matching sync client read timeout behavior.
PID file mechanism removed entirely. Pipeline now uses in-memory _active_runs dict with proper cleanup via _cleanup_terminal_runs(). Eliminates TOCTOU race condition.
All debug print statements removed from intercom_client.py. Code now uses proper logger.info/warning/debug calls throughout.

Exclusive timestamp behavior documented in search_by_date_range_async docstring at lines 374-375: 'start_timestamp: Unix timestamp for start of range (exclusive: >)' and 'end_timestamp: Unix timestamp for end of range (exclusive: <)'.
